channel.title: MBallSectionsDR
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from MBallSectionsDR, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Tulsi Gabbard clears Senate test vote on path for confirmation as director of national intelligence
item.description: Director of National Intelligence nominee Tulsi Gabbard cleared a key Senate test vote on Monday, all but assuring she'll be officially confirmed to t...

item.title: Neither State Nor Territory: Trump Has A Third Option On Greenland
item.description: If the Danes don't want to sell Greenland and the locals don't want to form the 51st state, President Donald Trump is left with a third option.

item.title: The Courts Are Slowing Trump Down, Not Necessarily Stopping Him
item.description: Despite the tone of media coverage, all these judges have done, for now, is raise important questions.

item.title: Daughters Of The American Revolution Doubles Down On Letting Men Infiltrate Its Ranks Against Members’ Wishes
item.description: ‘It’s ridiculous that we're having to talk about this, having to fight so hard to keep our women's society free of men.’

item.title: Murkowski and Cassidy announce they'll vote to confirm Tulsi Gabbard to Trump cabinet post
item.description: Sens. Lisa Murkowski and Bill Cassidy announce they will vote to confirm former Rep. Tulsi Gabbard to serve as Director of National Intelligence

item.title: Trump says 'all hell is going to break out' if Hamas doesn't release remaining hostages

item.title: Trump pauses enforcement of law banning bribery of foreign officials
item.description: President Trump signed an executive order Monday directing the Justice Department to pause its enforcement of a decades-old law that prohibits America...

item.title: FBI must release Mar-a-Lago probe records despite Trump's criminal immunity: judge
item.description: FBI records from the Mar-a-Lago classified documents probe will be released in relation to a FOIA case despite the case's dismissal and Supreme Court'...

item.title: Trump pardons Rod Blagojevich, calling it an 'honor' to do so
item.description: President Trump has pardoned Rod Blagojevich, the former Illinois governor who attempted to sell the Senate seat of former President Barack Obama afte...

item.title: DeepSeek’s Direct Challenge to Antitrust Orthodoxy
item.description: The Chinese company’s R1 sent shockwaves through the tech world.

item.title: Democrats Stung by the Cult of Youth, Again
item.description: Of all the disorienting revelations voters imposed on Democrats, young voters’ departure from their ranks may be the most bewildering.

item.title: A Job for DOGE? Fast Repair of Our Stone Age Air Traffic Control
item.description: Why doesn’t America get with the rest of the world?

item.title: The Persecuted Must Survive the Wrecking Ball
item.description: JD Vance suggests that religious freedom worldwide is a priority for the second Trump administration.

item.title: How A Minnesota School District Is Trying To Drive Out A Trump-Supporting Teacher For Sharing A Meme
item.description: A Minnesota school district appears to be trying to drive one of their teachers out because she shared a meme supporting Trump's deportation policy.

item.title: Trump says paper straws are out, plastic is in
item.description: President Trump signed an executive order Monday calling for the return of plastic straws and doing away with paper ones.

item.title: Trump signs executive order ending 'forced use of paper straws'

item.title: Cultural Recovery Is Going To Take More Than Schmaltzy Super Bowl Commercials
item.description: With its feel-good sentimentalism, corporate America is celebrating relics of an identity for which it's largely lost the vocabulary.

item.title: Lori Chavez-DeRemer: The little-known Trump nominee who may need to rely on Dems to cross finish line
item.description: President Trump's pick to lead the Department of Labor, former Rep. Lori Chavez-DeRemer, R-Ore., has left Republicans in the Senate with some question...

item.title: Naval Academy Launches Review Of School Clubs To Ensure Compliance With Trump’s DEI Prohibition
item.description: The Naval Academy is reviewing school clubs and activities to ensure compliance with Trump's prohibition on DEI, The Federalist has learned.

item.title: 'Designated terrorists': Extremist groups raked in millions from USAID, multiyear study reveals
